tit.cmt: "/Hisaakira"→"(his name can also be read as Hisaakira)"
tit.e: Imperial Prince Hisaaki (his name can also be read as Hisaakira)

sen.j: 久明親王（ひさあきしんのう／ひさあきらしんのう、建治2年9月11日 (旧暦)（1276年10月19日） - 嘉暦3年10月14日 (旧暦)（1328年11月16日））は、鎌倉幕府8代征夷大将軍。
sen.e: Prince Hisaaki/Hisaakira (October 19, 1276-November 16, 1328) was the 8th Seii taishogun of the Kamakura Shogunate.
sen.cmt: 分かり易くするために旧暦は記載していません。
sen.e: Prince Hisaaki (October 19, 1276-November 16, 1328) was the 8th Shogun of the Kamakura Shogunate.
sen.cmt: Deleted "/Hisaakira""Seii taishogun"→"Shogun" - I think "Shogun", which is more familiar to English speakers, suffices.
sen.e: Imperial Prince Hisaaki (October 26, 1276 - November 24, 1328) was the 8th Seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of the Kamakura Shogunate.
sen.cmt: スペース補足征夷大将軍→seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians")グレゴリオ暦に変更Imperialを追加しました。

sen.e: He assumed the post of Ippon Shikibukyo.
He assumed the post of Ippon Shikibukyo (a high ranking royal member of the government).
He assumed the post of Ippon Shikibukyo (a high ranking royal member of the government).

sen.j: 第89代後深草天皇の第六皇子で、母は内大臣三条公親の娘・従二位房子。
sen.e: He was the 6th son of the 89th Emperor Go-Fukakusa and his mother was Fusako in Ju ni-i, a daughter of the Interior Minister (Naidaijin) Kinchika SANJO.
He was the 6th son of the 89th Emperor, Go-Fukakusa, and his mother was Fusako in Ju ni-i, a daughter of the Interior Minister (Naidaijin), Kinchika SANJO.
He was the 6th son of the eighty-ninth Emperor, Gofukakusa, and his mother was Fusako in Junii (Junior Second Rank), a daughter of Naidaijin (minister), Kinchika SANJO.

sen.j: 妻は前将軍惟康親王の娘。
sen.e: His wife was a daughter of the former Shogun, Prince Koreyasu,
His wife was a daughter of the previous Shogun, Prince Koreyasu.
His wife was a daughter of the previous Shogun, Imperial Prince Koreyasu.

sen.j: 正応2年（1289年）9月、前将軍惟康親王が京に送還されたことに伴い、征夷大将軍に就任した。
sen.e: In September, 1289, he became a Seii taishogun since the former Shogun, Prince Koreyasu was sent back to Kyoto.
In September, 1289, he became the Seii Taishogun when the previous Shogun, Prince Koreyasu was sent back to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: "a"→"the"Capitalized 't' - kept "Seii Taishogun" to prevent "Shogun" appearing twice in close proximity"since"→"when""former"→"previous"
sen.e: In September, 1289, he became the Seii Taishogun when the previous Shogun, Imperial Prince Koreyasu was sent back to Kyoto.

sen.j: 子の守邦親王に代わるまで特に業績もなく、延慶 (日本)元年（1308年）8月に北条氏によって将軍を解任され、京に送還され出家した。
sen.e: He didn't make any special achievement until his son, Prince Morikuni succeeded him, in August, 1308, he was dismissed as Shogun by the Hojo Clan and sent back to Kyoto, then he became an ordained monk.
His reign as Shogun was unremarkable until his son, Prince Morikuni, succeeded him in August, 1308, when he was dismissed as Shogun by the Hojo Clan, sent back to Kyoto and entered the priesthood.
sen.cmt: "He didn't make any special achievement"→"His reign as Shogun was unremarkable"Added "when""and"→","", then he became an ordained monk"→"and entered the priesthood"
sen.e: His reign as Shogun was unremarkable until his son, Imperial Prince Morikuni, succeeded him in August, 1308, when he was dismissed as Shogun by the Hojo clan, sent back to Kyoto and entered the priesthood.

sen.j: 冷泉為相女との間に久良親王がいる。
sen.e: He had a son, Prince Hisayoshi, with the daughter of Tamesuke REIZEI.
He had another son, Prince Hisayoshi, with the daughter of Tamesuke REIZEI.
He had another son, Imperial Prince Hisayoshi, with the daughter of Tamesuke REIZEI.

sen.j: 当時、幕府の実権は得宗・北条貞時が握っており、将軍は名目的な存在であった。
sen.e: At that time, Tokuso Sadatoki HOJO assumed control over the Shogunate and Shogun was just a figurehead.
During this period, Tokuso Sadatoki HOJO controlled the Shogunate, with the Shogun just a figurehead.
sen.cmt: "At that time"→"During this period""assumed control over"→"controlled""and"→"with the"Deleted "was"
sen.e: During this period, Tokuso Sadatoki HOJO controlled the Shogunate, with the Shogun just a figurehead.
